page.title: 16TRANSPORT/LONGTOWN,CUMBRIA
page.content: Longtown has a surprising number of Road-Haulage Contractors for a town of its size.In 1985 there were four medium sized firms operating fleets of lorries.The reasons for this situation are various.Proximity to the motorway system and major trunk routes of the Borders.The need to transport large quantities of timber from the soft-wood forests,collection of milk from farms,and the carriage of large numbers of cattle and sheep.All of the companies are long established,and have built up much good-will with their customers over the years,and as a result there has been minimal cutbacks in the numbers of vehicles operating during the current recession.The innovatory techniques of using plastic pipes for drainage in agriculture has created a large increase in business for one firm.
